title: GDD

title: GDD
text: GDD (Growing Degree Days) measurement heat units plant absorbed throughout day. GDH (Growing Degree Hours) measurement GDD except measures hour day.

title: GDD
text: Measuring GDD GDH can help track developmental cycle crops.

title: GDD
text: plant, threshold temperature plant needs order start absorbing heat. Plants also maximum temperature plant absorb anymore heat. GDH, take temperature listed hour Compare temperature plant’s high low thresholds temperature high low, keep temperature temperature high threshold, keep high threshold temperature temperature low threshold, keep low threshold temperature Take keep temperature subtract low threshold temperature GDD, sum GDH calculations divide low temperature threshold. methods calculating GDD, current method works best data pulled data base.

title: GDD
text: \[ \text{GDH}_i = \cases{ \text{T}_i - \text{BT}   & $\text{HT} > \text{T}_i > \text{BT}$ \cr                       \text{HT} - \text{BT}     & $\text{T}_i>\text{HT}$ \cr                       0                         & $\text{T}_i < \text{BT}$}\\ \text{} \\ \text{T temperature,} \\ \text{BT base temperature thresholdof crop,} \\ \text{HT high temperature threshold crop,} \text{} \text{ hour temperature taken.}   \] \[ \text{GDD} = \frac{\sum{\text{GDH}}}{\text{Base Temperature}} = \frac{\text{GDH}_1 + \text{GDH}_2 + ... + \text{GDH}_{24}}{\text{Base Temperature}} \]

title: GDD
text: gdh() function calculates GDH hourly temperatures found within temperature file returns GDD days given original file.

title: Getting specified field's metadata — get_chunk_info

title: Getting specified field's metadata — get_chunk_info
code: # Set coordinates of farm field farm_coords <- c(43.854, -111.776) # Download HRRR grid metadata to get chunk_id and x and y for coordinates nc_data <- load_index_data() # Get chunk coordinates for farm field chunk_info <- get_chunk_info(farm_coords[1], farm_coords[2], nc_data) chunk_id <- chunk_info[1] in_chunk_row <- chunk_info[2] in_chunk_col <- chunk_info[3]

title: Reading Data from URL returned by get_url function — read_grid_from_url
code: # Get a grid of temperature data for grid chunk 5.3 on June 24, 2022 at 3 PM MDT hrrr_url <- get_url(     as.POSIXct("2022-06-24 15:00:00", format="%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S", tz="US/Mountain"),     "5.3") # The URL is  "https://hrrrzarr.s3.amazonaws.com/sfc/20220624/20220624_15z_anl.zarr/surface/TMP/surface/TMP/5.3" data_grid <- read_grid_from_url(hrrr_url)
